input_text:
Job Title: Associate Director, Commercial Data Operations - Acquisitions

Location: Mettawa, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Company Description

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.

Job Description

The Marketing Analytics and Business Insights (MABI) function supports AbbVie’s US organization and is comprised of highly respected researchers, analysts, data scientists and strategists who are committed to being best-in-class within the biopharmaceutical industry. We serve as a strategic in-house counsel, ensuring that all decisions leverage the key insights that we develop. We continue to build new capabilities and skill sets, encouraging our team members to pull up a chair, be themselves, be creative, speak their minds, and do good work. We are a passionate, diverse, flexible, and inclusive organization with a culture that supports the best ideas, wherever they originate. We are smart, fun, quirky, and innovative – and we’d love for you to join us.

As the Associate Director of Commercial Data Operations, you will be responsible for overseeing data acquisition, integration, delivery, and utilization across US Therapeutic Operations. You will develop and execute strategies for maximizing AbbVie’s investments in syndicated aggregated prescription and patient claims data from purchase (contracts) through transformation to the consumption layer.

This role offers a challenging and rewarding opportunity to ensure commercial data acquisition supports the data needs of various business units and drives business value. Specifically, this role will support Brand Analytics, Sales Operations, Market Access, and Patient Services teams. If you are a data-driven leader with a passion for patient-centricity and experience managing healthcare data, we encourage you to apply.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Acquisition and Integration:Develop effective strategies for acquiring Claims and Rx data from syndicated and specialty networks, ensuring diverse sources are utilized.Manage vendor data contracts, budgets, and vendor relationships to ensure quality, compliance, and cost-effectiveness.Define an effective data acquisition strategy through understanding of user needs, therapeutic area dynamics, and vendor data coverage and quality capabilitiesCollaborate with stakeholders regularly to assess and acquire data based on their specific requirements, proactively addressing anomalies in data quality and supplier dynamics.Work collaboratively with data stewards and IT teams to establish business rules and data quality standards for integrating commercial data.Monitor and oversee data pipelines to ensure accurate and efficient ingestion, cleansing, and transformation of data, ensuring data quality standards are met.Provide ownership of commercial data domains, being accountable for the quality, availability, and usability of Rx data, and resolve data issues promptly.Manage both internal AbbVie resources and external offshore resources to successfully achieve business objectives and ensure smooth operations.Data Delivery and Utilization:Oversee the integration of Rx and Claims data from multiple vendors ensuring the anonymization of the data and data quality is maintained throughout the integration process.Deliver consistent, trustworthy syndicated and specialty Rx and claims data to internal stakeholders across commercial functions.Develop and implement data access governance policies and procedures.Define and implement data quality rules and cleansing procedures.Collaborate with stakeholders to define data needs and translate them into actionable data delivery formats and reports.Commercial Analytics and Operations Support:Collaborate closely with sales operations teams to support sales force incentive compensation quota modeling and sales crediting.Analyze trends and anomalies in external data, proactively data quality issues and coverage gaps to provide support for various business unitsTechnology and Systems:Partner with IT teams to design, build, and manage secure and efficient data acquisition and reporting pipelines for commercial functions.Stay up-to-date on data management technologies and trends, recommending solutions to improve data quality and accessibility.Ensure compliance with data privacy and security regulations (e.g., HIPAA, CCPA).Stakeholder Management:Collaborate effectively with data owners, business system owners, platform owners, data operations teams, and other key stakeholders across the organization.Effectively lead organizational change that improves data qualityCommunicate commercial data operations challenges to stakeholders.
Qualifications

Required:

Bachelor's degree in related field, such as Information Systems.Minimum 10 years of professional experience with at least 5 years in data operations.Proven track record of successfully managing and delivering high-quality data for patient-centric initiatives.Deep understanding of commercial data sources and data needs within pharma (e.g., IQVIA, Symphony Health).Strong analytical and data visualization skills.Excellent communication, collaboration, and presentation skills.Ability to manage and motivate cross-functional teams.Leadership experience and proven ability to drive improvements in commercial analytics and operations through data utilization.Knowledge of data privacy and security regulations (e.g., HIPAA, CCPA).

Preferred:

Experience with data management tools and platforms (e.g., data warehouses, ETL tools).Experience with healthcare data systems and platforms.Experience working within a regulated environment.Experience with managing Patient services programsProject management skills.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Additional Information

Applicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law:

The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future. We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees. This job is eligible to participate in our short-term incentive programs. This job is eligible to participate in our long-term incentive programs .

Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, incentive, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole and absolute discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole and absolute discretion, consistent with applicable law.

AbbVie is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives, serving our community and embracing diversity and inclusion. It is AbbVie’s policy to employ qualified persons of the greatest ability without discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected group status.

Experience Level (if available): Director
